104768.name: Percentage of workers who relied on personal contacts to find their current job
104768.datasetName: Methods used by employed workers to find their current jobs - Pellizzari (2010)
104768.s_name: Methods used by employed workers to find their current jobs - Pellizzari (2010)

source.name: Methods used by employed workers to find their current jobs - Pellizzari (2010)
source.dataPublishedBy: Pellizzari, M. (2010). Do friends and relatives really help in getting a good job?. ILR Review, 63(3), 494-510.
source.dataPublisherSource: Pellizzari (2010) based on European Community Household Panel data
source.additionalInfo: Employed workers in the ECHP are asked to indicate how they have found their current job. The exact phrasing of the question reads: ”By what means were you first informed about your current job?”. Six possible answers are offered, and respondents can choose only one. The sample includes individuals aged 16-64 in 14 European countries over the period 1994-1999.
